questions.question_text: Which capability is used by Ansible to run a set of tasks when a property is changed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I’m pretty sure it’s handlers

comments.content:
I agree. "Sometimes you want a task to run only when a change is made on a machine. For example, you may want to restart a service if a task updates the configuration of that service, but not if the configuration is unchanged. Ansible uses handlers to address this use case. Handlers are tasks that only run when notified."

Source: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbook_guide/playbooks_handlers.html

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the code from the bottom onto the box where the code is missing to obtain an authorization token by using the Cisco DNA Center API. Not all options are used.

//IMG//
In test-driven development, what are two of the green bar patterns? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: where is this on the blueprint?

comments.content: Another fair and quality exam by Cisco :eyeroll

discussion.content: C and E are correct answer.

Selected Answer: CE
this made it more clear for me 
https://gist.github.com/jameshwang/5335032

Selected Answer: CE
Triangulate and Fake it
This info is not included in my Netacad content

A. another test (Red Bar Pattern)
B. break (Red Bar Pattern)
C. triangulate (Green Bar Pattern)
D. starter test (Red Bar Pattern)
E. fake it (Green Bar Pattern)

A. another test 
B. break (Red Bar Pattern)
C. triangulate (Green Bar Pattern)
D. starter test (Red Bar Pattern)
E. fake it (Green Bar Pattern)

questions.question_text: Into which type of Python data structure should common data formats be parsed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
JSON: JSON data can be parsed into a Python dictionary using the json.loads() function from the built-in json module. This function takes a JSON string as input and returns a dictionary representing the data.
both C and D are correct
"common data formats" are JSON and XML, and the they are in a nested python dictionary.

Selected Answer: D
Option A, "sequence," is incorrect because a sequence is a general term that refers to any ordered collection of items, and does not specify a specific data structure. Option B, "set," is incorrect because a set is an unordered collection of unique items, and may not be suitable for storing parsed data that needs to be ordered. Option C, "dictionary," is incorrect because a dictionary is an unordered collection of key-value pairs, and may not be suitable for storing parsed data that needs to be ordered.

Selected Answer: C
I would say C, as dictionaries are the most precise for data
